text: Henry Warren "Hank" Hartsfield, Jr. (November 21, 1933 - July 17, 2014) was an American NASA astronaut and test pilot. He was also a United States Air Force officer and astronaut. He spent over 480 hours in space. He was best known for being on board the Space Shuttle Columbia. He was also a commander for the Discovery and Challenger missions. Hartsfield was born in Birmingham, Alabama. He was married and had two daughters. Hartsfield died from problems caused by back surgery on July 17, 2014 in Houston, aged 80. ==References== ==Other websites== * Henry Hartsfield at Astronauts Scholarship Category:1933 births Category:2014 deaths Category:American astronauts Category:Deaths from surgical complications Category:NASA Category:Scientists from Birmingham, Alabama Category:United States Air Force
title: Henry Hartsfield
